item.title: American-Made Energy and Good Jobs Act

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 464.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 184 (Roll no. 207). (text: CR H3236)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 184 (Roll no. 207).(text: CR H3236)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H3244)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 835.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H3236-3245)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 184.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5429 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-480, by Mr. Bishop (UT).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-480, by Mr. Bishop (UT).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5429) to direct the Secretary of the Interior to establish and implement a competitive oil and gas leasing program that will result in an environmentally sound program for the exploration, development, and production of the oil and gas resources of the Coastal Plain of Alaska.
Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 5429 (American-Made Energy and Good Jobs Act).
Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 5429 (American-Made Energy and Good Jobs Act).

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5429) to direct the Secretary of the Interior to establish and implement a competitive oil and gas leasing program that will result in an environmentally sound program for the exploration, development, and production of the oil and gas resources of the Coastal Plain of Alaska, and for other purposes.

item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5429) to direct the Secretary of the Interior to establish and implement a competitive oil and gas leasing program that will result in an environmentally sound program for the exploration, development, and production of the oil and gas resources of the Coastal Plain of Alaska, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5429) to direct the Secretary of the Interior to establish and implement a competitive oil and gas leasing program that will result in an environmentally sound program for the exploration, development, and production of the oil and gas resources of the Coastal Plain of Alaska, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
